meanings.definition: A bitter white alkaloid found in coffee, tea, and various other plants.
meanings.sent1: Caffeins are natural compounds in coffee and tea.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the taste of coffee, which contains caffeins.
meanings.sent3: The caffeins in tea give it a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The bitter taste of caffeins in coffee wakes me up in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The presence of caffeins in plants helps them defend against pests.

meanings.definition: A stimulant that affects the central nervous system.
meanings.sent1: After drinking an energy drink, I could feel the caffeins working in my body.
meanings.sent2: Caffeins can make you feel more awake and alert.
meanings.sent3: I like to joke that the caffeins in my coffee are my little energy boosters.
meanings.sent4: The caffeins in my system felt like tiny sparks igniting my brain.
meanings.sent5: The effect of caffeins on the nervous system is similar to turning on a light switch.

meanings.definition: A substance that can increase alertness and reduce fatigue.
meanings.sent1: When I need to stay awake, I rely on caffeins to keep me alert.
meanings.sent2: Caffeins help me push through tiredness during long study sessions.
meanings.sent3: I pretend that the caffeins in my coffee are tiny superheroes fighting off sleepiness.
meanings.sent4: The caffeins in energy drinks are like little soldiers battling my fatigue.
meanings.sent5: The power of caffeins to combat tiredness is truly remarkable.
